Message.Title: Should Chicago be the model for federal gun control laws?
Message.Msg: Currently Illinois does not issue concealed carry licenses, nor does it recognize CCL's from other states. Open carry is also illegal, except when hunting. A firearm can only be transported if it is unloaded and locked in a case. The city of Chicago requires that all firearms be registered with the local police department. Based upon these laws and others, the state of Illinois and the city of Chicago should be one of the safest locations in the country as far as firearms and the problems that they present are concerned. I have listened to our president and members of his party talk about the evils of guns and those who choose to own guns are, and have come to agree with them. Guns are evil and the people that own them are also evil. Further if we could only confiscate all of the guns from those evil law abiding citizens, then there would be no murders in our country ever again, because our entire country would become a firearm free zone, and everyone knows how safe firearm free zones like schools, churches, post offices, and movie theaters have become. Again the president is correct take all of the guns away from those evil law abiding citizens, because then and only then will the people of this country be safe. In the case of Chicago only 400 homicides had been recorded for the first nine months of 2012, and I am sure that since Chicago is a virtual gun free zone none of those homicides were caused by guns. In your heart you know he is right, The Frogg

Topic.Title: Wack job, jon...

Message.Msg: ... “When called out, and asked to take his views to Newton to see how the grieving parents and families would react to his malignant and insidious suggestion, he (jon) reacts in his typical fashion – “dance til your balls fall off” and tales of “man-bras” - all very mature responses to a legitimate question of his boorish insensitivity.” That was yesterday – In his intellectual debate style of ignoring the issue at hand, he counters with another round of school yard taunts equivalent to “so’s your mother!”, although nowhere near that sophisticated. His responses, all seemingly steeped in bathroom bodily function obsession, indicated that he suffers from various paraphilia, likely brought on by childhood abuse. Hence, rather than either denying or acknowledging that he said the authorities in Newton were manipulating evidence for political purpose, his retort was as follows: “Your Flatulency” - “Chit For Brains” - “change your depends" - "hershey squirts" – “EAT MY SHORTS” - “grand orifice” I rest my case. “I'm not hiding .. just let me know when you get near Richmond and I'll work out the arrangements to accomimodate (SIC????) you .... ya disgusting LITTLE pigmy pus-bag - SMILES !! Oh, MY, jon! You are one disturbed individual. Okay, jon, give me your address. Wear your digital cammies you got in the 60’s (again, no response) and bring your entire macho gun show collection (in all likelihood, a pellet gun and a Whamo slingshot) I’ll bring an unabridged dictionary. BTW, how is it you’re here everyday? I thought you mowed yards or had a paper route or somethin’. Plus, I thought you lived in Charlottesville. What happened? I guess with all these websites out there now identifying predators, you have to move around a lot. Try Connecticut. There are people up there waiting for you to come tell them how their losses were just a conspiracy for an attack on the 2nd Amendment.

Topic.Title: Should Chicago be the model for federal gun control laws?

Message.Msg: Just another version of "we need to arm the elementary school teachers." I went to college in a state that outlawed a type of alcohol called Everclear, but I sure did drink alot of it in those days. Everclear was legal the next state over, and thus was easy to get. It should tell you something that Mexican drug cartels come to the US to legally purchase weapons and then smuggle them over the border. Froggie is simply making the case for a Federal ban, since local or state bans don't work. But I imagine that will go undetected by many on this board.

Topic.Title: Wack job, jon...

Message.Msg: ... I don’t disagree with you in the slightest. I was merely pointing out, that, IMO, the truly “modern weaponry” is not something that you or I or the public even knows about. And that isn’t at the state level. I believe we have weapons that can assure that we will never lose an “all-out” war (beyond nukes), although that doesn’t bode well for mankind. On the other hand, Rick Perry or jon or any like-minded individual, cannot, at this point at least, take out Washington with a space-based laser, was my point. On the other hand, if jon was leading a secessionist effort from Richmond, I would think the Jefferson Davis Monument could be vaporized at a moment’s notice as a warning, if so desired. (Kinda’ like “The Day the Earth Stood Still” - "Klaatu barada nikto") Seriously, I don’t think our capabilities are really known by many, least of all, the local National Guard.

Topic.Title: Should Chicago be the model for federal gun control laws?

Message.Msg: ... “I went to college in a state that outlawed a type of alcohol called Everclear” I went to college in a state that didn’t! Ah, yes, Everclear, he said with fond memories. The brand name of Grain Alcohol available at two different potencies – 151 proof (for rookies) or (the only one used) 190 Proof – 95% pure alcohol. The main ingredient in “Creepers”, a college recipe handed down through the ages and mixed in metal Garbage Cans for college parties. Ten quarts per garbage can, Two parts -Grapefruit juice, two parts – oh, wait I’m sworn to secrecy about the recipe. “Creepers”, So named, because with little taste or aroma, the coeds loved them, but halfway through your first one, they crept up on you. If you couldn’t get lucky with Creepers, you had to be jon.

Topic.Title: Conn Shooter's Mom, tried to commit him

Message.Msg: Just the other day, in China a 36 year old man, (who had a psycological illness), sliced, and diced 22 children with a knife, who were entering their school. No one was killed, but it wasn't for his lack of trying. So, as usual gun grabbers are going against the weapon, but not the criminal.

Topic.Title: Conn Shooter's Mom, tried to commit him

Message.Msg: Yes. That man injured 22 children. It took him over half an hour to do so. (Slow response times in China). Lanza killed 26 people in a little over two minutes before police arrived. Most of those had multiple rounds (up to 11). If he had been less thorough, he probably could have gotten more. See the difference? Do you understand that while the criminal is responsible for launching the attack, it is the gun that allows him to kill 26 people? How many people do you think Lanza could have injured with a two-minute response time? Do you think those teachers may have been able to stop him from injuring anyone if he were only armed with a knife? No one expects crime to disappear without assault rifles. We expect the carnage to diminish. If there is one thing we do know, the existence of large numbers of guns in our society has not reduced crime or carnage. Evidence is it has increased it.

Message.Title: Cars versus guns...
Message.Msg: ... “And then, compare your list to the number of automobile related deaths in the U.S. Every year for the last 62 years those deaths have exceeded 32,367 each and every year. There have been well over 2 MILLION of them since 1950! Do you also advocate "automobile control" too? After all, if there were no cars = no car deaths. Same illogical argument as your gun control fantasy!” – gms47cb (that would be jon) Hey, what great logic. I’ll go one step further. Eliminate all the automobiles and they’ll be no more drive-by shootings! Advocate automobile control? No, I just renewed my license, tags and insurance simply because I enjoy spending time at the BMV – Why? Are there laws that say I have to do that stuff? Oh, right, the “automobile control” of which you are apparently oblivious, has already favorably impacted the statistics. Thanks for, quite accidentally on your part, debunking your “Illogical argument”. And how timely – check this out, goofy. Gun deaths set to outstrip car fatalities for first time in 2015 Liz Goodwin – The Lookout – earlier today “The CDC estimates that auto-related deaths--long on the decline as more motorists wear seat-belts and face harsher penalties for drunk driving--will fall to 32,000 in 2015. Deaths from firearms, which include suicides and accidents, are estimated to rise to 33,000 over the same period.” You really don’t have to argue with these people. Just give them enough rope… Oh, wait, rope legislation pending. Oh, wait again…they already did that with the hemp laws. Change that…give them enough rope and they’ll embarrass themselves to death.

Message.Title: Sandy Hook
Message.Msg: To understand what happened I think we will never know . To talk of gun control is an issue that we should address . I feel that automatic weapons should be banned...large ammo clips also..yet weapons legally purchased should not be banned . If we lived in a perfect world then there would be no crime...yet there is..and a lot of it .Think for one moment what runs through the mind of a common criminal that robs a bank or a simple store. I hate to say it but the gun owners do have a valid point .Criminals do not care about the laws concerning guns ,their only concern is to rob . You who would take weapons from everyone are wrong..for then only the bums would have weapons . Criminals DO NOT care about laws only about getting away with a crime .Your zealous actions will be counter productive .
